author: fidelis
title: [Catholic Caucus] My Catholic Life! “I Thirst!” - Friday, March 29, 2024 - Catholic Caucus/Devotional
text:
Consider the thirst of Jesus. Though His physical thirst must have been excruciating as He hung upon the Cross, pouring forth His precious blood upon the world, the spiritual thirst our Lord felt would have greatly overshadowed His physical thirst. His spiritual thirst is for you, for your soul, for your salvation. As He hung upon the Cross, Jesus did not think of Himself, His suffering or His wretched physical condition. Instead, He thought of you and of all those for whom He was giving His life.
Psalm 69:22 says, “Instead they gave me poison for my food; and for my thirst they gave me vinegar.” Jesus fulfilled this Scripture passage as He thirsted on the Cross. The vinegar symbolically refers to each one of us. The vinegar given to our Lord on the Cross was spoiled wine. Each one of us, symbolically speaking, is this spoiled wine. The purity of our humanity has been corrupted by original sin. As a result, we are not the people God intended us to be by nature. But in our fallen state, we have the potential to satiate Jesus’ spiritual thirst.
As you think about your own life, what do you see? Can you see yourself as spoiled wine? Perhaps it is a bit humiliating to think of yourself this way. But humility is good, especially when we understand that our Lord longs for us in our brokenness. Upon the Cross, Jesus did not cry out for the best of wine, the finest and most delicious. As He thirsted on the Cross, He longed to be satiated by you, in your weakened and broken state, just as you are, so that He can pour forth His cleansing mercy upon you.
As soon as Jesus tasted the sour wine, He cried out, “It is finished.” This symbolically represents His soul being satiated by you every time you turn to Him in your need. It’s amazing to consider the fact that you have the ability to console the Heart of Jesus and satiate His thirst this way. Saint Thérèse of Lisieux was very fond of a devotion dedicated to consoling Jesus’ Heart. As a child, she was given a prayer card that pictured Jesus in prison, looking out at one small flower. Thérèse saw herself as that one small flower who was given the mission to console Jesus’ Heart by visiting Him regularly in the prison of the tabernacle.
Spiritually speaking, that moment of Jesus’ thirst on the Cross permeates all time and continues today. Every time you come to Him in your need, especially when you come before Him in the Eucharist, He turns His eyes to you and calls to you, inviting you to console Him by offering Him the humility and brokenness of your life...
Reflect, today, upon Jesus on the Cross. Gaze at Him as He gazes at you. See the longing in His Heart for you. Know that He gave His life for you, so that you could receive the gift of new life. Know, also, that your openness to this gift of His life poured out for you will console our Lord’s Heart and bring His divine mission of salvation to fruition. Satiate our Lord’s thirst today so that He can once again say, “It is finished.”
My thirsting Lord, Your Sacred Heart longs for me with a love that is infinite and incomprehensible. You desire that I come to You, receive Your love and satiate Your thirst. As I gaze upon You in Your suffering state, I open myself to You and to the gift of Your Precious Blood poured out for me. May my openness to You be a consolation to You as I receive Your divine love. Jesus, I trust in You.

author: Federico Garau
title: "Offende l'Islam", niente Divina Commedia a scuola: cosa è successo a Treviso - ilGiornale.it
text:
Due giovani alunni di una scuola media della provincia di Treviso sono stati esentati dallo studio della Divina Commedia a causa del fatto che il capolavoro dantesco è stato classificato come opera a sfondo religioso e di conseguenza in contrasto con la loro fede e coi loro ideali: la richiesta dei genitori degli studenti protagonisti della vicenda è stata quindi recepita dall'istituto scolastico, che ha proposto il Boccaccio per sostituire il Sommo Poeta fiorentino.
Stando a quanto riferito dalla stampa locale, proprio prima di iniziare a parlare della Divina Commedia come parte integrante del programma scolastico, sarebbe stato il professore di italiano a porsi lo scrupolo di chiedere alle famiglie degli studenti che erano già stati esentati dall'ora di religione l'autorizzazione a trattare l'opera letteraria caposaldo della cultura italiana.
Tra la presenza di Inferno, Purgatorio e Paradiso e il rischio che la rappresentazione di Maometto potesse risultare offensiva per i praticanti musulmani, quindi, i genitori dei due alunni hanno chiesto e ottenuto che i figli fossero esentati dallo studio dell'opera. Per loro, dunque, niente lezioni o interrogazioni su Dante, che è stato sostituito dal Boccaccio nel programma scolastico concordato con l'insegnante.
Non si tratta della prima volta in cui il capolavoro dantesco ha creato più di qualche grattacapo nelle classi miste in cui sono presenti studenti di religione musulmana. A spiegare i motivi per cui la Divina Commedia risulta invisa all' Islam è stato il professor Alberto Pezzè. "Può sicuramente urtare la sensibilità dei musulmani il fatto che nell'inferno, in particolare nel 28esimo canto, Dante incontri Maometto perchè lo considera un seminatore di discordie" , dichiara l'ex docente durante un'intervista concessa ad Antenna 3. E questo per il fatto che il Sommo Poeta "dà credito e dimostra di credere ad una leggenda, nata probabilmente in ambiente crociato, ma che non ha nessun fondamento di verità, per la quale Maometto sarebbe stato addirittura un prete cristiano che non è riuscito a far carriera e, arrabbiato per questo, quindi avrebbe fondato questa nuova religione" . "È sempre il solito problema, di accettare il punto di vista degli altri, da tutte e due le parti" , conclude il professor Pezzè.

author: Pia Seitler
title: An einigen Orten lauert eine unsichtbare Gefahr, die unsere Hirnleistung schädigen kann
text:
An einigen Orten lauert eine unsichtbare Gefahr, die unsere Hirnleistung schädigen kann
Um das Gehirn fit zu halten, existieren zahlreiche Tipps. Ein Wissenschaftler erklärt, wieso der Wohnort die Hirnleistung bremsen könnte und welche Symptome auftreten.
Acht Stunden Schlaf, eine Handvoll Walnüsse und ein Italienisch-Kurs für Anfänger: Wer sein Gehirn fit halten will, hat viele Möglichkeiten. Stress und ungesunde Lebensmittel sollte er hingegen vermeiden. Dass, je nachdem wo er oder sie wohnt, auch ein Umzug die Gehirnleistung verbessern könnte, zeigen Forschungsergebnisse aus Rostock.
Die Forschenden der Uni Rostock konnten mit einem Neurologen und Epidemiologinnen der Universität Groningen in den Niederlanden einen Einfluss von Feinstaub auf die Gehirnleistungsfähigkeit nachweisen. Dafür werteten sie Daten von etwa 50.000 Personen im Alter von 18 bis 92 Jahren aus. Sie maßen bei den Probanden beispielsweise die Lungenfunktion und die kognitive Leistungsfähigkeit.
Feinstaub gelangt aus Motoren von Autos, durch das Bremsen, Industrieprozesse, Öfen und Heizungen in die Luft und könne über mehrere Mechanismen das Gehirn schädigen, erklärt Benjamin Aretz. Zum einen über den direkten Transport zum Gehirn. Dieser verläuft vermutlich über den Blutkreislauf beziehungsweise den Geruchsnerv und endet im Gehirn. Zum anderen über oxidativen Stress: „Das Immunsystem im Hirn gerät in Alarmbereitschaft. Es kommt zu entzündlichen Zytokin-Ausschüttung, welche Nervenzellen angreifen kann“, sagt Aretz BuzzFeed News Deutschland von Ippen.Media.
Feinstaub schadet der Gehirnleistung: Welche Symptome auftreten können
Aretz forscht zu Umwelteinflüssen auf die Gesundheit des Menschen und war an der Studie beteiligt. „Die Luftverschmutzung bremst die geistige Leistungsfähigkeit“, sagt er. Das könne sich in unterschiedlichen Symptomen zeigen. Es könnten Gedächtnisstörungen auftreten, also Schwierigkeiten beim Kurzzeit- und Arbeitsgedächtnis und Konzentrationsprobleme, weil die Aufmerksamkeit schneller nachlasse und es schwerer falle, Reize zu filtern.
Die beeinträchtigte Gehirnleistung durch die Luftverschmutzung könnte zu längeren Reaktionszeiten und mentaler Ermüdung führen, zu Lernschwierigkeiten und Frühzeichen einer Demenz. Auch emotionale Symptome wie depressive Verstimmungen und Antriebslosigkeit seien möglich.
Städte, in denen die Feinstaubbelastung so hoch ist, dass sie negative Auswirkungen auf das Gehirn hat
Die Weltgesundheitsorganisation schlägt einen Grenzwert für Feinstaubbelastung im Jahresmittel von 5 µg/m³ vor. Aktuell liegt der EU-Grenzwert bei 25 µg/m³, ab 2030 wird er auf 10 µg/m³ gesenkt. „Studien zeigen, dass bereits Langzeitexposition zwischen 5 und 10 µg/m³ negative Auswirkungen für Gehirn und Kognition haben“, sagt Aretz.
Beim Thema Feinstaubbelastung denken viele an Stuttgart – hier wurde häufig der Tagesgrenzwert überstiegen. Es gab Feinstaub-Alarm, Mooswände und Diesel-Fahrverbote. Seit 2018 hält Stuttgart die gesetzlichen Grenzwerte der Luftreinhaltung an allen Messstationen ein, heißt es auf der Homepage der Landeshauptstadt.
Wenn man sich Jahresmittel der Luftschadstoffbelastung für 2024 anschaue, war diese vor allem in Cottbus, Schönefeld, Berlin-Neukölln und Blankenfelde-Mahlow besonders hoch. „Dies schwankt aber auch zwischen den Jahren“, weiß Aretz. Grundsätzlich seien die Belastungen längerfristig betrachtet in Berlin, Stuttgart, Düsseldorf, München, Hamburg insgesamt recht hoch – im Bereich zwischen 8-11 µg/m³. „In diesem Bereich findet man auch entsprechend negative Auswirkungen für Kognition und Gehirn“, sagt der Forscher.

author: OSEN
title: Moon Won clears up transgender DM misunderstanding, calls it fake news - CHOSUNBIZ
text: Singer Moon Won, who will marry Shin Ji of the group Koyote next year, has been embroiled in a misunderstanding involving a transgender DM. Ultimately, it was a misunderstanding, but once again he was hurt by unnecessary fake news.Transgender BJ Kkotja said in a personal broadcast on the 16th, "It is true that Moon Won and transgender Sarah knew each other from the past, but they did not get to know each other after her transition," adding, "Moon Won was not aware that Sarah was gay or that she had become transgender."Earlier, during a broadcast conducted by Kkotja on the 11th, a viewer asked transgender Sarah, who appeared as a guest, "How did you come to follow each other on social media?" Sarah replied, "Moon Won? Who is that?" and stated, "Upon checking, it is true that we follow each other."After that, Kkotja checked the DM on Sarah's mobile phone and appeared flustered, and Sarah was also surprised after checking the DM. When the viewers asked, "If Kkotja gives 100 million won, can you disclose the message content?" Sarah replied, "It’s impossible," but when the amount was raised to 1 billion won, she said, "Then it’s possible. I can also disclose Kakao messages for 500 million won."Regarding this, Kkotja explained, "Those comments at that time did create room for misunderstanding. However, upon checking, there was no conversation content that could be problematic. The two originally knew each other simply as an older brother and younger sister during the time Sarah was preparing Trot music, even before she transitioned."He continued, "Moon Won did not even know that Sarah was transgender, to the extent that he checked her social media account and asked, ‘Is it my girlfriend who's messing around?’ It’s possible he unfollowed in surprise, but it’s not a strange relationship at all. Recently, my photos have circulated and led to articles, but it's frankly nothing significant. Please don’t interpret this too excessively."Meanwhile, Shin Ji and Moon Won are scheduled to marry next year. On the 16th, Shin Ji shed tears recalling a time when she suffered from misunderstandings and rumors related to Moon Won during a broadcast of tvN's 'Yoo Quiz on the Block.'[OSEN]

author: S.M.
title: Haute-Saône. A vélo sur la Voie bleue Moselle-Saône, découvrir le riche patrimoine local
text:
Haute-Saône A vélo sur la Voie bleue Moselle-Saône, découvrir le riche patrimoine local

author: Agence France Presse (AFP)
title: Tempête Gerrit au Royaume-Uni : Trois morts dans un 4x4 retrouvé dans une rivière
text:
Publicité
Tempête Gerrit au Royaume-Uni
Trois morts dans un 4x4 retrouvé dans une rivière
Par
Partager cet article
Tempête Gerrit au Royaume-Uni
Trois morts dans un 4x4 retrouvé dans une rivière
Trois hommes ont été retrouvés morts jeudi, piégés dans un véhicule retrouvé dans une rivière au nord de l'Angleterre, frappé comme d'autres régions du Royaume-Uni par la tempête Gerrit qui a provoqué de fortes intempéries, a annoncé la police locale.
Alertés un peu avant midi (heure GMT) qu'un véhicule était tombé dans la rivière Esk, près de la ville de Glaisdale, les services de sécurité ont été déployés sur les lieux.
«Le véhicule a été repêche dans la rivière par les pompiers peu après 15H00 (GMT). Malheureusement, les trois hommes qui se trouvaient à l'intérieur sont morts», a indiqué la police du North Yorkshire dans un communiqué.
Un autre homme qui avait tenté de les aider a été récupéré sain et sauf, a-t-elle précisé, ajoutant que les conditions météo locales «rendent la conduite automobile dangereuse».
Plusieurs régions du Royaume-Uni, en particulier en Ecosse et dans le nord de l'Angleterre, sont frappées depuis mercredi par la tempête Gerrit qui a entraîné d'importantes chutes de pluie et de neige, ainsi que des vents violents, avec notamment 136 km/h enregistré dans l'Aberdeenshire en Ecosse.
Des vents tourbillonnants qualifiés de "tornade" par la police et provoqués par un orage supercellulaire, selon l'Agence nationale de météorologie (Met Office), a également dévasté une centaine de maisons près de Manchester dans la nuit de mercredi à jeudi, sans faire de blessé.
Des milliers de logements restaient sans électricité jeudi après-midi en Ecosse, tandis que les transports ferroviaire et aérien sont perturbés avec des trains et des vols annulés.
Des automobilistes sont également restés plusieurs heures coincés dans leur véhicule à cause de la neige, et des routes ont été coupées par des chutes d'arbres sur la chaussée ou des inondations.
Plus au sud, le transport de ferries entre Douvres et la France a également subi des retards mercredi à cause des vents forts soufflant sur la Manche, selon la compagnie DFDS.

author: BBC News
title: Snow and ice warning as freezing weather continues
text:
Temperatures plummeted to -6C in Scotland overnight with a yellow weather warning for icy conditions across the country.
Homes were evacuated in the village of Toward at 05:30 after a lorry hit a gas main near Dunoon in Argyll.
The Far North railway line remains closed between Inverness and the Kyle of Lochalsh floowing floods and landslips.
Wintry conditions are forecast to continue into next week, with widespread snow expected to hit large parts of the country on Sunday.
Eskdalemuir in Dumfries and Galloway felt the coldest temperatures, dropping to -6.4C at 23:00 on Thursday.
Snow also fell again overnight across the Highlands and Aberdeenshire.
Police Scotland closed the A815 near Dunoon after the HGV crash into a gas main.
The force said a number of properties were evacuated as a precaution, but there were no reported injuries.
BBC Weather Watchers A blanket of snow fell in Portmahomack in the Highlands Fresh weather warnings have been issued by the Met Office for further snow across Scotland on Sunday and Monday.
Weather presenter Kirsty McCabe, editor of MetMatters at the Royal Meteorological Society, said there could be up to 20cm of snowfall in places.
She told BBC Radio's Good Morning Scotland programme: "There's potentially a lot of snow to come, but as well as the snow there always the risk of freezing rain.
"You can get black ice, really hazardous conditions on the roads.
"It's not especially unusual, its not record-breakingly cold, but it's not great as Monday for many is going to be the first day back at school or back at work.
"There will be this legacy of wintry weather and nasty conditions."
The yellow weather warning for snow is in place from the early hours of Sunday until midday on Monday.
The Met Office said the greatest risk was in southern and eastern Scotland, where up to 5cm could accumulate, with 10 to 20cm over high ground.
Rain or sleet is more likely near some northern and eastern coasts.
Temperatures drop across UK as arctic blast brings more snow Rail and roads hit as cold moves across country
